message.content:
Veronica anagallis-aquatica is a flowering plant species in the genus Veronica. 
It is commonly known as water speedwell due to its preference for moist environments. 
The plant has small, bright blue flowers with a four-petalled shape. 
These flowers grow in spikes on stem tips. 
The leaves are opposite and oval shaped with serrated edges, and are a deep green color. 
Water speedwell can be found growing naturally near streams, ponds, and other bodies of water across much of North America and Europe. 
It is also commonly used in water gardens for its attractive flowers and ability to control algae growth.
